logic

Class QCamera

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.QCamera

  • public class QCamera
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for attaching camera to the game screen.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QCamera

        public QCamera(int leftRightBoundary,
       int topBottomBoundary,
       int centerX,
       int centerY)
        We can't have a camera without few parameters first right? So let's initialize.
        Parameters:
        leftRightBoundary - The left and right boundary which has to be passed for the camera to start moving.
        topBottomBoundary - The up and down boundary to pass for the camera to move up or down.
        centerX - Center x coordinate of the camera.
        centerY - Center y coordinate of the camera.

    • Method Detail

      • setBoundaries

        public void setBoundaries(int leftRightBoundary,
                 int topBottomBoundary)
        In case if you ever need to change boundaries from what you originally set them to.
        Parameters:
        leftRightBoundary - The left and right boundary after which the camera will move.
        topBottomBoundary - The top and bottom boundary after which camera will also move.

      • setCenter

        public void setCenter(int x,
             int y)
        Once again if you ever need to change the center of the camera.
        Parameters:
        x - Center x coordinate of the camera.
        y - Center y coordinate of the camera.

      • updateCamera

        public void updateCamera(int x,
                int y)
        Update camera position based on the coordinates which it should be looking at.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the object.
        y - Teh y coordinate of the object.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
        QBox box)
        Draws given box with its coordinates shifted, so that it is in accordance with the camera. Much better than default method of box's drawing with slightly higher cost.
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics to which to draw.
        box - The box you would like drawn.
